<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need to use a new LLVM integer type if there is a mismatch between</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="977"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of bits in LLVM and SPIRV integer types to let DuplicateTracker</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="978"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ensure uniqueness of a SPIRV type by the corresponding LLVM type. Without</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="979"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// such an adjustment SPIRVGlobalRegistry::getOpTypeInt() could create the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="980"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// same &quot;OpTypeInt 8&quot; type for a series of LLVM integer types with number of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="981"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bits less than 8 This would lead to duplicate type definitions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// eventually due to the method that DuplicateTracker utilizes to reason</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// about uniqueness of type records.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="984"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;SPIRVGlobalRegistry::adjustIntTypeByWidth(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="986"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SrcBitWidth = IType-&gt;getBitWidth();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="987"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcBitWidth &gt; 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Maybe change source LLVM type to keep DuplicateTracker consistent.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
